result.execSummary:
The defendant Ross W Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
05/20/15 COURT GRANTS SENTENCE CREDIT OF 122 DAYS.
Concurrent with: any current sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution of $30,264.30 to be paid (jointly and severally liable) as a Condition of Extended Supervision as follows:  $16,600.00 to Barbara S.; $3,608.00 to Liberty Mutual Ins.; $765.00 to Paul and Brenda N.; $941.06 to Jesse D.; $1,728.01 to AAA Insurance; $1,035.69 to Janis G.; $962.74 to Integrity Insurance; $1,290.00 to Daniel H.; $833.80 to Daniel M.; $2,500.00 to American Family Insurance.
AMENDED ON 11/09/2015:  COURT ORDERS THAT RESTITUTION AMOUNT BE TAKEN ONLY FROM THE DEFENDANT'S EARNING ACCOUNT.  RESTITUTION SHALL NOT BE PAID FROM ANY GIFT MONEY WHILE INCARCERATED.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.
Cout costs and DNA surcharge are waived.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Count #1.   But Concurrent to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Same conditions for extended supervision apply as to Count 1.
Court costs and DNA surcharge are waived.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Ross W Weber in court, in custody, with attorney M E Weathers.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Christine Bohn, supervised by Pablo Galaviz, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeaters from Counts 1 and 2.  Court grants motion.  Repeaters struck from Counts 1 and 2.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 3-9 dismissed and read in.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Court orders the following: 

Count 1:
- Total sentence: 9 years (Initial Confinement: 6 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years) CONCURRENT with any current sentence.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Restitution of $30,264.30 to be paid (jointly and severally liable) as a Condition of Extended Supervision as follows:  $16,600.00 to Barbara S.; $3,608.00 to Liberty Mutual Ins.; $765.00 to Paul and Brenda N.; $941.06 to Jesse D.; $1,728.01 to AAA Insurance; $1,035.69 to Janis G.; $962.74 to Integrity Insurance; $1,290.00 to Daniel H.; $833.80 to Daniel M.; $2,500.00 to American Family Insurance
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Continue with AODA treatment/counseling.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  

Count 2:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year, Extended Supervision: 1 year) CONSECUTIVE to Count 1 but CONCURRENT with any other sentence.
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs waived
- DNA Surcharge waived
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Same as Count 1.
